Today, @AppropsDems congratulates our 12 new subcommittee Vice Chairs for the 116th Congress, who will work together with the Chairs & the entire committee to invest in working families, rebuild our crumbling infrastructure, & conduct robust oversight of the Trump Administration. pic.twitter.com/fmagR0GVSC
WATCH: @AppropsDems Homeland Security Chairwoman @RepRoybalAllard’s opening statement from today’s conference committee: https://twitter.com/RepRoybalAllard/status/1090763266589188096 …

ICYMI: Today, @AppropsDems members of the Conference Committee on Homeland Security Appropriations announced proposals for smart & effective border security measures that uphold American values ➡️  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-democratic-conferees-unveil-proposal-for-smart-effective-border-security … pic.twitter.com/EXhHCVZ97h

Chairwoman @NitaLowey, Homeland Security Subcommittee Chairwoman @RepRoybalAllard & @AppropsDems have unveiled proposals for smart & effective border security measures that uphold American values. 

Read the full list →  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-democratic-conferees-unveil-proposal-for-smart-effective-border-security … pic.twitter.com/339gSbvQKx

.@AppropsDems support smart investments in ports of entry, humanitarian assistance, technology improvements, & personnel to comprehensively strengthen border security. 

Because border security is more than physical security, & homeland security is more than border security.

Homeland Security Chairwoman & @AppropsDems conference committee member @RepRoybalAllard: There's been a lot of inaccurate rhetoric about a security crisis at the border that supposedly can only be solved by a multi-billion dollar border wall.

I hope that all stakeholders, including @POTUS, will work in good faith to support us as we carry out our responsibilities.

Together, we can secure our border and uphold our values.

Read @NitaLowey's full statement: https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairwoman-lowey-statement-at-house-senate-conference-committee-on-homeland …

I know that the American people are counting on us to come to a reasonable and responsible solution.

Consistent with the proud tradition of our committees, I am confident that we will be able to reach a compromise.

It is also important to recognize that the @DHSgov bill includes other key pieces of our nation’s security platform, including the @USCG, @TSA, and @FEMA.

Every dollar spent on ineffective proposals means one less dollar invested in measures that actually keep us safe.
Smart border security is not overly reliant on physical barriers, which the Trump administration has failed to demonstrate are cost effective compared to better technology and more personnel.
My Democratic colleagues and I are ready to work in good faith to write a Department of Homeland Security bill that funds smart, effective border security.
In the next 16 days, our task is clear: finalizing appropriations legislation that responsibly funds much of the federal government – everything from our National Parks to border security.
We can all agree that we must do everything we can to prevent another unnecessary and destructive government shutdown.

THREAD: @AppropsDems Chairwoman @NitaLowey on today's @HouseDemocrats spending bill package:

The #TrumpShutdown, now in day 33, must end without delay so the federal government can get back to fully working on behalf of the American people.

If members of the Republican Party are serious about governing, they will pass these funding bills & allow our federal employees to be paid and get back to work.

Today, #TrumpShutdown is 1️⃣ month old. 

1️⃣ month of federal workers keeping our skies, borders, & communities safe w/o pay

1️⃣ month of @POTUS holding the US economy hostage for an ineffective border wall

#EndTheShutdown pic.twitter.com/dkq4dmrIwA

A week ago, the #TrumpShutdown had cost the U.S. economy $3.6 billion. 

By the end of next week, it could be more than $5.7 billion, the same amount that the President is holding our country hostage for to build his wasteful border wall. https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/1/14/18179000/trump-wall-economic-cost-shutdown-jerome-powell …

“How long can it go on? We’re counting the days until we’re out of business” These are some of the many faces of the #TrumpShutdown: furloughed, working without paychecks, or unsure if their business will survive without critical programs & federal funds. https://www.wsj.com/articles/shutdown-is-a-hellacious-situation-for-federal-government-contractors-11547634603 …

As workers continue to go without pay & families continue to worry about their SNAP benefits and when their next paycheck will come — our entire economy faces long-term damage. 

Americans deserve better. 

They deserve an end to this #TrumpShutdown. https://www.politico.com/story/2019/01/16/shutdown-raises-risk-recession-1102370 …

.@NitaLowey: Protecting Dreamers & TPS recipients is the right thing to do. @POTUS is wrong to hold them hostage over money for a wasteful wall that could be better spent on more effective border security measures.

U.S. Virgin Islands Rep. @StaceyPlaskett: This bill is a positive relief package for Americans in our island territories still reeling from disaster, where our hospitals are not back in operation & where our children just went back to a full day of school this October.

Chair of @HomelandDems @BennieGThompson: In 2018, Americans faced catastrophic hurricanes, wildfires, & volcanoes. Last week, @POTUS responded by saying he plans to stop aid to wildfire survivors. This bill shows the American people we stand with them, even if @POTUS does not.

Incoming Chairwoman of @AppropsDems Homeland Security @RepRoybalAllard: It's critical that Congress ensures every federal resource is made available to the state, local governments & all affected communities from unprecedented 2018 wildfires. This shouldn't be a partisan issue.

Incoming Chairwoman of Mil. Con.-VA @RepDWStweets: In addition to the $12.14 billion to assist relief and recovery efforts from recent hurricanes, typhoons & wildfires, this bill also provides $860.4 million for the @DeptofDefense construction needs & @DeptVetAffairs.

.@POTUS grossly mismanaged response to Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico 🇵🇷, & repeatedly tried to shortchange fellow U.S. citizens. This bill rights that injustice, meets urgent needs of Americans in the Northern Marianas, Guam, American Samoa, & Puerto Rico. pic.twitter.com/7FzipQLq2I

Interior & Environment Chair-Designee @BettyMcCollum04: This emergency funding is a sharp contrast with @POTUS's threats to block disaster response funds to CA communities who are struggling to rebuild their lives after devastating wildfires. These families deserve our support.

Senior @AppropsDems member @RepBarbaraLee: Families from across California recovering from wildfires deserve the assistance we're considering today. Natural disasters can impact any district. This $12.1 billion will help all who need help recovering from past & future disasters.

Agriculture Subcommittee Chairman-Designee @SanfordBishop: Last year, Hurricane Michael devastated Georgia's communities & agricultural sector, which accounts for 1 in 7 GA jobs. 

This bill includes $1.86 billion of recovery assistance for all U.S. farmers & rural communities. pic.twitter.com/BnQGiFo4l6

This bill ensures Congress remains a critical partner in helping communities rebuild & prepare for future natural disasters. 

This bill would also clear out $1.5 billion backlog of emergency highway & bridge repair projects, securing infrastructure fixes for future generations.

✅ $2.96 billion to rebuild infrastructure & help bring communities back to life

Outside of the IRS, small businesses, which make up the backbone of our economy, also take a hit, with no access to @SBAgov loans during the shutdown. Those businesses will remain unable to make capital improvements, and entrepreneurs can’t even attend workshops to seek advice.

Taxpayers rely on the IRS to assist them in making big choices for their financial planning. That advice helps families make important decisions, like whether to put money into their savings or buy that new appliance to replace a broken one.

All four of the bills are identical, with the exception of a provision ensuring back pay for furloughed federal employees, to bipartisan Senate bills that were passed on a 92-6 vote.

First up, the Financial Services and General Government bill, which ensures that hardworking families can receive their tax refunds. 

The House will also consider the Agriculture, Interior-Environment, and Transportation-HUD appropriations bills.

NEW: On a 239-192 vote, the House has passed legislation to reopen the Department of Homeland Security through February 8 at existing funding levels.

The legislation includes no new wall funding, and allows time for negotiations on border security & immigration policy.
